intro: Senecio korintjianus, commonly known as the Korintjianus groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy, white seed heads. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is often cultivated in gardens.
